title: Stags' Leap Winery 2013 The Investor Red (Napa Valley)
description: This new blend features 38% Merlot, 32% Petite Sirah, 18% Cabernet Sauvignon and 12% Malbec, combining brawn with beauty. Red fruit and a light grip of oak wrap around a softly textured body, making for an approachable, easygoing experience.

title: Redbank 2014 The Long Paddock Pinot Grigio (Victoria)
description: An admirable effort, combining lemony citrus notes with hints of pear and quince. It's medium in body, with a long, crisp finish.

title: Thanisch 2015 Lieserer Niederberg Helden Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate and dancing on the palate, this light-footed Riesling highlights crystalline mineralilty against a backdrop of zesty grapefruit, lime and lemon flavors. Off dry in style, it finishes moderately long with lingering hints of bramble and crushed stones.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2012 The Rainbow Gap Vineyard Grenache (Temecula Valley)
description: Rose hips and petals, potpourri, ginger snaps and dark strawberry show on the lush nose of this bottling by Don Lorenzi, whose Italian family has been making wine for generations. Strawberry and lush cherry flavors meet with increasignly prominent nutmeg and allspice once sipped. The palate is quite hearty and full of dried fruit.

title: Quady North 2015 Pistoleta White (Rogue Valley)
description: This chewy, tangy white wine is an engaging blend of 42% Viognier, 33% Marsanne, 23% Roussanne and a splash of Grenache Blanc. Fresh flavors of citrus, apples and pineapple abound. If you're looking for an unoaked alternative to Chardonnay, this is a good option.

title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Dona Louise Red (Dão)
description: Young vines grown at heights of 1,200-feet give a cool character to this Touriga Nacional dominated blend. It is a structured wine, stylish with perfumed fruit flavors that have been smoothed by the oak aging. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Piattelli 2014 Grand Reserve Malbec (Cafayate)
description: This pitch-dark Malbec from Cafayate is concentrated and heavy on the nose, with grapy blackberry aromas that are doing their best to stay fresh and clean. A full-force, grapy palate deals chocolaty black-fruit flavors in front of a warm finish where toasty oak and graphite notes come onto the scene.

title: Pio Cesare 2012 Il Bricco  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of French oak, espresso, toast and a whiff of rose. The dense, chewy palate offers dried black cherry, coconut, roasted coffee bean and grilled sage alongside bracing tannins that clench the finish. An orange zest note signals the close the finish. Give the tannins a few years to unfurl then drink.

title: Fullerton 2014 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This distinctive biodynamic vineyard is near the Van Duzer Corridor, destined to become its own AVA soon. The fruit is a mix of berries and cherries, with a touch of Popsicle sweetness. There are notes of earth and barnyard also, well-integrated, and often found in such natural wines. Still pulling itself together, but complex and compelling already.

title: Hewitson 2013 Baby Bush Mourvèdre (Barossa Valley)
description: Smells leathery and savory, then folds in ripe, plummy fruit on the mouthfilling palate. Finishes supple and softly dusty. Ready to drink now.

title: Grimaldi Bruna 2012 Bricco Ambrogio  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of menthol, blue flower and dark berry lift out of the glass. The tannic palate is still primary, offering tart sour cherry and star anise while a hint of dried sage closes the firm finish.

title: FEL 2014 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Floral aromas and a bowl full of spiced fruit flavors bring a lot of enjoyment to this rich and generous tasting, full-bodied wine. It has touches of spicy oak, rose petal, citrus and ripe peach.

title: Dr. Fischer 2014 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Aromas of sun-kissed grapefruit and berries waft from this concentrated mélange of fruit and flowers. Off dry on the palate, it's punchy and fresh, balancing bright, lemony acidity against a core of apple and pear flavors. The finish is marked by hints of exotic spice and tea tannins.

title: Minkov Brothers 2013 Tradition Since 1875 Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: This garnet colored Bulgarian Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of dark cherry and mocha with flavors of cherry cola, black raspberry and black cherry with a smooth silky tannic finish.

title: Mirafiore 2010 Lazzarito  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting toast, dark-skinned berry, smoke and a balsamic note. The firm palate delivers dried black cherry, licorice, sage and a hint of clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2020.

title: Angove 2013 Warboys Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: Full bodied and supple, this is a dark wine with ample fruit. Cassis and black cherry notes pick up hints of cola on the finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Ascheri 2012  Barolo
description: This opens with aromas of grilled porcini, menthol and a hint of Asian spice while the straightforward palate offers ripe raspberry, dark cherry and cake spice. Firm, fine-grained tannins provide support.

title: Bella Grace 2013 Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This dry wine delivers aromatic complexity, firm tannins and solid fruit flavors for an appetizing balance. It smells like raspberries and cedar, tastes like cranberries and raspberries, and finishes with a nice touch of astringency.

title: Bodega Calle 2013 Dharma Reserva Red (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Gritty, earthy aromas of hot tarmac and leathery plum give off a burnt character. Easy, smooth and flush across the palate, this blend of 70% Petit Verdot and 30% Malbec tastes peppery, spicy and of roasted black fruits. Toastiness carries over to the finish, which deals burnt, peppery spice notes and mild heat.

title: Vicentin 2013 Gen Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Upfront earthy aromas of black olive render this Malbec's berry notes as secondary. This feels chunky, even a bit flabby. Flavors of black fruits and peppery spice finish with a note of oaky mint and drying tannins. Drink now through 2018.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 OMG Red (Lisboa)
description: You could think of this wine as an exclamation. It is certainly rich and generous with its bold black fruits and dark tannins. There is a juicy component to the wine as well, spicy and full of berry flavors. It is ready to drink.

title: Chambers Rosewood Vineyards NV Muscadelle (Rutherglen)
description: Full-bodied and sweet, this amber-hued fortified is one of the entry points into the Chambers universe. Dried figs and soy sauce mark the nose, while the flavors combine hints of mushrooms, roasted meat and maple syrup. The finish is long, with just a hint of scorched sugar.

title: Château de Santenay 2014 La Comme Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: While there is little white wine in Santenay, the vines for this wine come from a small parcel near the château. It is soft and rounded, smooth and creamy. With white stone-fruit flavors lifted by light acidity, it is ready to drink now.

title: Château de Santenay 2014 Le Roc Blanc  (Mercurey)
description: Layers of wood aging give this wine its initial spicy character. The flavors broaden out to bring in the ripe citrus and yellow fruits that are already well developed. With its edge of minerality, the wine still has room to age. Drink from 2017.

title: Clear Night 2014 Riesling (Pfalz)
description: For such a small price, this off-dry Riesling offers surprising refreshment and enjoyment. It's straightforward and fruity, bursting with white-peach and pear flavors, yet remarkably pristine in style. Zesty lemon-lime acidity showers the midpalate and leads a long rejuvenating finish.

title: Domaine Des Meix Porons 2014 Les Pimentiers  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: From vines in the plain between Corton and Beaune, this wine is full of ripe red fruits. Its soft, rounded character is spiced with acidity and the wood aging. Soft tannins fill the texture. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine des Valanges 2014 Paquet Montagnac  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This is a ripe, full wine with both the fruit and the fresh acidity of the year. Rich yellow fruits are cut with the citrus acidity, hints of toast and spice, with a refreshing backbone. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Cálem NV Special Reserve  (Port)
description: The wine is spicy with a fine tang of spirit and wood to give it a real tawny character. Acidity is there as well for the lift at the end. It is mature while keeping its dried fruit flavors and a rich aftertaste.

title: Trapiche 2012 Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard Malbec (La Consulta)
description: This Malbec is strangely exotic, with unusual floral aromas that blend in Middle Eastern spices including cardamom. Massive and borderline over-extracted, this tastes earthy and baked, with herbal blackberry flavors. A blackened, peppery flavor dominates a finish that comes across as stewed.
designation: Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard

title: Trivento 2014 Armado Sur Malbec-Bonadra-Syrah Red (Mendoza)
description: Dark in color and ripe from the get go, this Malbec blend smells of blackberry, graphite and licorice. Full and layered, with surprisingly good depth, this tastes of black fruits blended with tomato and plum. Spicy, dry and herbal tasting on the finish, with a hint of saltiness.
